name: places/ChIJre5ftoX2wokRfGq9_K8JNBg
formattedAddress: 610 W 158th St, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: 610 W 158th St, New York, NY 10032, USA

originalText.text: If i had Zero to give i would. Front desk is totally unprofessional. The front desk failed to communicate where am i going and why. Once i get to another young lady, as soon as i get to her she tells me “Mam sit down “ i was confused?! Why tell me to go around to this young lady's face for her to tell me to sit down not once but twice without explanation, then her coworker touches her shoulder and she explains to me that they are texting the doctor to see if they can see me today. . These ppl messed up from the moment i got there. Telling me i had a video visit when my baby to get shots. It was just a mess. at the Front desk Maria had the nastiest attitude. This is bad for Presbyterian since they are number 1 in NYC and one of my favorite hospitals but this clinic for sure is not one to rely on. MARIA at the front desk needs a fixed attitude or a new job where she is happy because that young lady for sure miserable.

originalText.text: This is the worst place for medical care that I have ever known in my entire life. Recession people are totally bad educated, messy, they don't want to serve in Spanish, the nurses don't provide good service and speak very badly to pregnant women. Thanks to them I lost my baby this year because a doctor ordered me to do a sonogram. It was urgent to be able to do a cesarean section and since they didn't care and saw everything as relaxed, they scheduled it for 3 weeks later, knowing that it was urgent. They made me cry and wait for hours, and I ended up pregnant so they could treat me. They took advantage of the vulnerability of a pregnant woman. She could continue writing about the bad things they do in that place because there were more than a hundred lawsuits. They should fire all those who work in reception or close that center if they do not want to continue being filled with lawsuits.

originalText.text: I come from afar and I loved this medical center especially for doctor killeen (David) but since he left making an appointment is impossible, in fact I made an appointment 3 months ago for today, and they tell me that they can't see me because the doctor is sick,  they are supposed to have someone to replace at the time of the same appointment, I gave up everything to come here and on top of that the one in front told me why she had come 5 minutes late who were filling out a paper right there that they were not going to attend to me, what kind of professionalism is this? absolutely zero.

originalText.text: I want to be clear that this review is for the front desk only because the doctors at that clinic are awesome but the front desk are rude with the patients, when you ask them a question they act like you are bothering them, they give you attitude and sometimes they make you go from one to the next just to answer a simple question. They don’t hide the fact that they feel you are disturbing them  . Their costumer service is awful i think some of them should be fired or retrain and show them show them how you treat people, they make ir hard for you to get a simple thing as an appointment.

originalText.text: I haven't been going there that much since I don't normally get sick so easily. This one time I requested an appointment via MyChart on a Sunday evening of the previous weekend not the Sunday that passed by. I received the notification yesterday and they gave me a video visit for the 20th at 7 PM. For one how would my doctor exam me via Zoom a video visit seems pointless when an examination is needed. It's a shame really. Not sure if anyone can relate. Then when I'm there at a few minutes early they take quite a while to register me for that visit. The doctor ends up seeing me late and I end up leaving late.
